) A security proÔ¨Åle is established and maintained for each user. User may choose their own password. Each password must consist of: ‚Ä¢ Be at least eight characters. ‚Ä¢ Contain a minimum of one alpha character upper and lower case, minimum of one numeric character, and one of the following # or - (underscore) with no spaces. ‚Ä¢ Differ from the user‚Äôs login (including any reverse or circular shift of login). ‚Ä¢ Cannot be the same as previous password. ‚Ä¢ Passwords are case sensitive. How and when to use the CAWR Query screen depends on what phase of program you are working. You will need to access either your assigned batches or individual case Ô¨Åles. There are two parts on the CAWR Query screen. They are ‚ÄúQuery by‚Äù and ‚ÄúCase Ô¨Åelds‚Äù. To access the CAWR Query screen left mouse click on the Query button The CAWR Query screen has Ô¨Åve main functions that are accessed by the selection of the radio buttons in the ‚ÄúQuery by‚Äù area of the CAWR query screen.
Individual Case Query: This is used mainly after the initial screening phase.
View Assigned Batches Query: This is mainly used during the phase when cases are assigned in batches.
Case # Query: This is used to query by control number.
SSN (Sched H) Query: This query is used when only the SSN is available.
Archive Query. This query option is used to access late reply case no longer exist in CAP.
